content: 31 decrease x 6 6 two upper wings fasten_off and leave a long tail with the sew the wings to the back of the body first the embroidery needle weave the yarn tail through lower wings between rounds 25 and 30 pointing the front loop of each stitch and pull to close slightly downwards and then the upper wings weave in the yarn tail between rounds 20 and 24 pointing slightly upwards you can use image 3 as a guide make lower wings sure that the upper and lower wings overlap and that they re directly opposite to the face grey round 1 start 6 single_crochet in a magic_ring 6 round 2 increase in all 6 st 12 round 3 single_crochet in next st increase in next st x 6 18 round 4 single_crochet in next st increase in next st single_crochet in next 2 st x 2 2 hd in next st 2 double_crochet in next st 2 treble_crochet in next st 2 double_crochet in next st 2 hd in next st single_crochet in next 2 st increase in next st single_crochet in next 3 st 26 light lilac round 5 slip_stitch in all 26 st 26 fasten_off and leave a long tail for sewing make two lower wings upper wings image 3 antennas grey round 1-3 repeat pattern for lower wings round 4 single_crochet in next st increase in next st single_crochet in next 2 light lilac st increase in next st x 5 single_crochet in next st 24 round 1 start 6 single_crochet in a magic_ring 6 round 5 single_crochet in next 3 st increase in next st x 2 single_crochet in round 2 increase in all 6 st 12 next 3 st 2 hd in next st double_crochet treble_crochet in next st treble_crochet in round 3 single_crochet in all 12 st 12 next st treble_crochet double_crochet in next st 2 hd in next st single_crochet in round 4 decrease x 6 6 next 3 st increase in next st x 2 32 page 3 grey sew each antenna to the top of the head over round 5-9 single_crochet all 6 st 6 rounds 4 and 5 make sure they re aligned with the face you can again use image 3 as a guide fasten_off and leave a long tail for sewing make the antennas don t need to be stuffed two antennas all done congratulations you finished your ellie the butterfly i can t wait to see your results feel free to tag me @faerie_stitches and use the hashtag #faeriestitches in case you decide to share your creation on instagram or don t forget to share your project on ravelry thank you page 4
